verses.verse: "I have spoken these things to you so that you might not be tripped.
They will make you excommunicated from the synagogue. But an hour is coming that everyone who kills you will seem to be bringing a sacrifice ritual to God.
And they will do these things to you because they didn't know the Father, nor Me.
But I have spoken these things to you so that when the hour comes you may remember them, that I told them to you. I didn't tell you these things from the beginning because I was with you.
Now I am going back to the One who sent Me, and no one from among you is asking Me, 'Where are you going back to?'
But because I have spoken these things to you, the sadness has filled your heart.
But I am telling you the truth. It is advantageous to you that I go away. You see, if I don't go away, the Encourager will not come to you. If I travel away, I will send Him to you.
And when that Encourager comes, He will reprimand the world concerning sin, concerning the right way, and concerning judgment
(certainly concerning sin because they don't trust in Me,
but concerning the right way because I am going back to My Father and you no longer see Me,
but concerning judgment because the head of this world has been judged).
I still have many things to be saying to you, but you are not able to be hauling them now.

When that Encourager comes, the Spirit of the Truth, He will guide you into all the truth. You see, He won't speak out from Himself, but however many things that He might hear He will speak, and He will announce to you the things coming.
That Encourager will make Me magnificent because He will receive from My Person and announce it to you.
All things, as many as the Father has, are Mine. Because of this, I said that He will receive from My Person and announce it to you.
A little while and you do not see Me, and again, a little while and you will look at Me because I am going back to the Father."

So some from among His students said to each other, "What is this that He is saying to us, 'A little while and you do not see Me, and again a little while and you will look at Me,' and 'Because I am going back to the Father'?"
So they were saying, "What is this that He is saying, the 'little while'? We don't know what He is speaking."

So Jesus knew that they were wanting to be asking Him. And He said to them, "Are you looking with each other for what I meant about this that I said, 'A little while and you don't see Me, and again, a little while and you will look at Me'?
Amen, amen, I tell you that you will cry and wail. The world will be happy. You will be sad, but your sadness will become for happiness.

When the woman is delivering, she has sadness because her hour came, but when the young child is born, she does not remember the hard times anymore, because of the happiness, that a person was born into the world.
So you also now certainly have sadness, but I will see you again, your heart will be happy, and your happiness no one takes away from you.
And in that day, you won't ask Me anything. Amen, amen, I tell you, that however many things that you ask the Father for in My name, He will give to you.
Until now you did not ask for anything in My name. Ask and you will receive so that your happiness may be happiness that has been filled up.
I have spoken these things to you in analogies. An hour is coming when I will no longer speak to you in analogies, but I will openly announce to you about the Father.
In that day, you will ask for things in My name, and I am not telling you that I will ask the Father about you.
You see, the Father Himself is fond of you because you have been fond of Me and have trusted that I came out from the side of God.
I came out from the side of the Father, and I have come into the world. Again I am leaving the world and traveling to the Father."
His students say to Him, "Look, now you are speaking openly and not telling any analogy.
Now we know that You know everything and have no need that anyone should ask You questions. We trust in this, that You came out from God."
Jesus responded to them, "Do you trust now?
Look, an hour is coming and has now come that you will be scattered each to your own places and will leave Me alone. And I am not alone because the Father is with Me.
I have spoken these things to you so that you may have peace in Me. In the world, you will have hard times, but be courageous, I have conquered the world."
